verses.text: And the \w word|strong="H1697"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* came unto \w Jonah|strong="H3124"\w* the \w second|strong="H8145"\w* time, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*,

\w Arise|strong="H6965"\w*, \w go|strong="H3212"\w* unto \w Nineveh|strong="H5210"\w*, that \w great|strong="H1419"\w* \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, and \w preach|strong="H7121"\w* unto it the \w preaching|strong="H7150"\w* that I \w bid|strong="H1696"\w* thee.

So \w Jonah|strong="H3124"\w* \w arose|strong="H6965"\w*, and \w went|strong="H3212"\w* unto \w Nineveh|strong="H5210"\w*, according to the \w word|strong="H1697"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*. Now \w Nineveh|strong="H5210"\w* was an \w exceeding|strong="H0430"\w* \w great|strong="H1419"\w* \w city|strong="H5892"\w* of \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w days’|strong="H3117"\w* \w journey|strong="H4109"\w*.\f + \fr 3.3 \ft exceeding: Heb. of God\f*

And \w Jonah|strong="H3124"\w* \w began|strong="H2490"\w* to \w enter|strong="H0935"\w* into the \w city|strong="H5892"\w* \w a|strong="H0259"\w* \w day’s|strong="H3117"\w* \w journey|strong="H4109"\w*, and he \w cried|strong="H7121"\w*, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, Yet \w forty|strong="H0705"\w* \w days|strong="H3117"\w*, and \w Nineveh|strong="H5210"\w* shall be \w overthrown|strong="H2015"\w*.

¶ So the \w people|strong="H0582"\w* of \w Nineveh|strong="H5210"\w* \w believed|strong="H0539"\w* \w God|strong="H0430"\w*, and \w proclaimed|strong="H7121"\w* a \w fast|strong="H6685"\w*, and \w put|strong="H3847"\w* on \w sackcloth|strong="H8242"\w*, from the \w greatest|strong="H1419"\w* of them even to the \w least|strong="H6996"\w* of them.

For \w word|strong="H1697"\w* \w came|strong="H5060"\w* unto the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Nineveh|strong="H5210"\w*, and he \w arose|strong="H6965"\w* from his \w throne|strong="H3678"\w*, and he \w laid|strong="H5674"\w* his \w robe|strong="H0155"\w* from him, and \w covered|strong="H3680"\w* \add him\add* with \w sackcloth|strong="H8242"\w*, and \w sat|strong="H3427"\w* in \w ashes|strong="H0665"\w*.

And he caused \add it\add* to be \w proclaimed|strong="H2199"\w* and \w published|strong="H0559"\w* through \w Nineveh|strong="H5210"\w* by the \w decree|strong="H2940"\w* of the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* and his \w nobles|strong="H1419"\w*, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*, Let neither \w man|strong="H0120"\w* nor \w beast|strong="H0929"\w*, \w herd|strong="H1241"\w* nor \w flock|strong="H6629"\w*, \w taste|strong="H2938"\w* any \w thing|strong="H3972"\w*: let them not \w feed|strong="H7462"\w*, nor \w drink|strong="H8354"\w* \w water|strong="H4325"\w*:\f + \fr 3.7 \ft published: Heb. said\f*\f + \fr 3.7 \ft nobles: Heb. great men\f*

But let \w man|strong="H0120"\w* and \w beast|strong="H0929"\w* be \w covered|strong="H3680"\w* with \w sackcloth|strong="H8242"\w*, and \w cry|strong="H7121"\w* \w mightily|strong="H2394"\w* unto \w God|strong="H0430"\w*: yea, let them \w turn|strong="H7725"\w* every \w one|strong="H0376"\w* from his \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* \w way|strong="H1870"\w*, and from the \w violence|strong="H2555"\w* that \add is\add* in their \w hands|strong="H3709"\w*.

Who can \w tell|strong="H3045"\w* \add if\add* \w God|strong="H0430"\w* will \w turn|strong="H7725"\w* and \w repent|strong="H5162"\w*, and turn \w away|strong="H7725"\w* from his \w fierce|strong="H2740"\w* \w anger|strong="H0639"\w*, that we \w perish|strong="H0006"\w* not?

¶ And \w God|strong="H0430"\w* \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* their \w works|strong="H4639"\w*, that they \w turned|strong="H7725"\w* from their \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* \w way|strong="H1870"\w*; and \w God|strong="H0430"\w* \w repented|strong="H5162"\w* of the \w evil|strong="H7451"\w*, that he had \w said|strong="H1696"\w* that he would \w do|strong="H6213"\w* unto them; and he \w did|strong="H6213"\w* \add it\add* not.
